person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - St. Vincent and the Grenadines

description.narrative: Assist the Government of St. Vincent and the Grenadines in resolving impediments to effective implementation of its anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) regime by focusing on (i) functioning of the financial intelligence unit (FIU) that is consistent with international standards and best practices; (ii) risk-based AML/CFT supervision of non-financial sectors that is consistent with international standards and best practices; and (iii) money laundering case development and asset forfeiture proceedings that are consistent with international standards and best practices.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - St. Vincent and the Grenadines

description.narrative: Assist the Government of St. Vincent and the Grenadines in resolving impediments to effective implementation of its anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) regime by focusing on (i) functioning of the financial intelligence unit (FIU) that is consistent with international standards and best practices; (ii) risk-based AML/CFT supervision of non-financial sectors that is consistent with international standards and best practices; and (iii) money laundering case development and asset forfeiture proceedings that are consistent with international standards and best practices.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes -St. Vincent & The Grenadines

description.narrative: Assist the Government of St. Vincent and the Grenadines (GoSVG) to resolve impediments to effective implementation of its anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) regime. Capacity building activities through 2017 will be focused on (i) improving the operation of the FIU; (ii) financial sector supervision with emphasis on the domestic banking sector through a concurrent ECT/Banking and Financial Services (BFS) engagement with the Eastern Caribbean Central Bank (ECCB); and (iii) financial crimes case development, including analysis, investigation, and prosecution of money laundering and underlying predicate crimes as well as asset recovery.
